p: Gingerols and shogaols in ginger rhizomes were responsible for the pungent taste ( Kikuzaki et al., 1994). 6-gingerol and 6-shogaol were the major gingerol and shogaol occurred in the ginger rhizome ( Connell and Mclachlan, 1972). Shogaols were more pungent than gingerols and were usually derived from the corresponding gingerols during thermal processing or long-term storage ( Zhang et al., 1994). Neither Rangoon nor Siddha the Sri Lankan variety yielded considerable amounts of pungency related chemicals. Consequently, it's imperative not to recommended Rangoon or Siddha varieties for industrial ginger pungency requirements.
